noun.description: The lateral part of the thalamus, which projects to the neocortex and is most highly developed in primates.

origin: Early 20th century; earliest use found in Journal of Comparative Neurology. From neo- + thalamus, after German Neothalamus (L. Edinger Vorlesungen über den Bau der Nervösen Zentralorgane des Menschen u. der Tiere (ed. 7) II. xv. 234).
